comments.en:
For basic printing functionality use the HPIJS driver . For advanced functionality such as printer status and maintenance features, use the HPLIP driver (which includes HPIJS).

According to David Suffield, HPIJS developer at HP, one gets the best results with the "hpijs" driver. Even that the normal color mode does only 300 dpi, it gives a better quality than the 600-dpi "Presentation" mode of the "cdj890" driver.

Good quality is also produced by Gimp-Print and the printer will probably work reasonably well with other "cdjXXX" drivers and the "pcl3" driver.

Minor color variations from Windows driver.

The "cdj890" driver is included with Ghostscript as of Ghostscript version 6.0.

Printhead alignment is not supported.
